title: Screen Shot 2017 09 27 at 11 35 13 PM

embed.description: Image Screen Shot 2017 09 27 at 11 35 13 PM hosted in imgbb.com

body:
As I recently started to pick up and play league again, both on the pbe and on live servers, I noticed something I've never seen before 
1.) Insane ammounts of FPS lag which I have never experienced before. Like sub 25 FPS. I usually sit steady at 120ish however since the new patches or something I mustve done to my computer I can barely play. 

2.) Another thing to note is that for some reason there are 3 instances of league of legends running when I look at activity monitor to see why my game is basically crashing I will include a link to a screenshot. [ https://ibb.co/gBoPZQ ] Does anyone have any logical explanation for this, it would be greatly appreciated. 

I know my computer can handle league of legends It has for the past 2 years now, so that's what worries me - if it's a server issue or a hardware issue on my part. Thank you guys for reading!

replies.body:
Since you've just picked League back up after a bit, those FPS issues might just be coming from a missed driver update is my first guess. Let's make sure to update your graphics drivers really quick, but if that doesn't seem to help check out the steps over here in our [**FPS guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) for some more quick fixes.

Those multiple instances of League are normal. League has a few different things running at once like the client and chat connections, so no worries there.
Thank you for clarifying on the multiple instances running, however I have never had to update a driver before as Im on mac, how would i go about doing so?

Ahhhhh you're on a Mac, I see. These things can work a little differently on that OS. Check out [**THIS FPS Guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684#section-mac) instead for the Mac steps.
